info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Graham, northeastern Cochise and southeastern Greenlee Counties through 630 PM MST... At 544 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northeast of Bowie, or 24 miles northwest of Steins, moving south and eastward at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bowie, Chiricahua National Monument and San Simon. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 361 and 391. Route 181 between mile markers 61 and 64. Route 186 between mile markers 353 and 359. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
